storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive real-time detection of overlapping time slots to prevent double bookings

testCases.title: Validate detection of overlapping time slots during booking creation
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Scheduling database is accessible and populated with existing bookings
At least one existing booking exists for a resource (e.g., Resource A booked from 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM)
Booking creation interface is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the booking creation page
steps.expectedResult: Booking form is displayed with fields for resource selection, date, start time, end time, and other booking details

steps.action: Select a resource that has an existing booking (e.g., Resource A)
steps.expectedResult: Resource is selected and displayed in the form

steps.action: Select a date and time slot that overlaps with the existing booking (e.g., 10:30 AM to 11:30 AM when existing booking is 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM)
steps.expectedResult: System immediately displays a real-time conflict alert message indicating an overlapping time slot with details including conflicting booking ID, resource name, and conflicting time range

steps.action: Attempt to save the booking by clicking the Save or Submit button
steps.expectedResult: System prevents saving the booking and displays an error message stating that the booking cannot be saved due to overlapping time slots

postconditions: No new booking is created in the database
Existing booking remains unchanged
Scheduler remains on the booking creation page with the conflict alert visible

testCases.title: Verify booking creation succeeds when no conflicts exist
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Scheduling database is accessible
At least one resource is available without any bookings for the selected time slot
Booking creation interface is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the booking creation page
steps.expectedResult: Booking form is displayed with all required fields

steps.action: Select a resource that is available (e.g., Resource B)
steps.expectedResult: Resource is selected and displayed in the form

steps.action: Select a date and time slot that does not conflict with any existing bookings (e.g., 2:00 PM to 3:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: No conflict alerts are shown, form remains in valid state

steps.action: Fill in all other required booking details (description, attendees, etc.)
steps.expectedResult: All fields are populated correctly

steps.action: Submit the booking form by clicking the Save or Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Booking is saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed with booking details, and user is redirected to booking list or confirmation page

postconditions: New booking is created and stored in the database
Booking appears in the schedule for the selected resource and time slot
Confirmation message is visible to the scheduler

testCases.title: Ensure conflict detection latency is under 1 second
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Scheduling database contains multiple existing bookings
Performance monitoring tool or browser developer tools are available to measure response time
At least one resource has an existing booking that can be used to trigger a conflict

steps.action: Navigate to the booking creation page
steps.expectedResult: Booking form is displayed

steps.action: Start timing measurement (using browser developer tools or stopwatch)
steps.expectedResult: Timer is started

steps.action: Select a resource and time slot that triggers conflict detection (overlapping with an existing booking)
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert appears on the screen

steps.action: Stop timing measurement when the conflict alert is fully displayed
steps.expectedResult: Elapsed time from selection to alert display is recorded and is less than 1 second (under 1000 milliseconds)

steps.action: Verify the conflict alert contains accurate details about the conflicting booking
steps.expectedResult: Alert displays correct booking ID, resource name, and conflicting time range

postconditions: Performance requirement of under 1 second latency is confirmed
Conflict detection system is functioning within acceptable performance parameters
No booking is saved

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive alerts for resource double-booking to avoid scheduling errors

testCases.title: Validate detection of resource double-booking during booking creation
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Resource allocation database is accessible
At least one resource is already booked for a specific time slot (e.g., Conference Room A booked from 9:00 AM to 10:00 AM)
Booking creation interface is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the booking creation page
steps.expectedResult: Booking form is displayed with resource selection and time slot fields

steps.action: Select a resource that is already booked for the selected time slot (e.g., Conference Room A)
steps.expectedResult: Resource is selected in the form

steps.action: Select the same date and time slot for which the resource is already booked (e.g., 9:00 AM to 10:00 AM)
steps.expectedResult: System immediately displays a real-time double-booking alert specifying the resource name, conflicting booking ID, and time details

steps.action: Attempt to save the booking by clicking the Save or Submit button
steps.expectedResult: System blocks the save operation and displays an error message indicating that the resource is already booked and the booking cannot be saved

postconditions: No new booking is created in the database
Existing resource booking remains unchanged
Double-booking alert remains visible on the screen
Scheduler remains on the booking creation page

testCases.title: Verify booking creation succeeds when resource is available
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Resource allocation database is accessible
At least one resource is available without any bookings for the selected time slot
Booking creation interface is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the booking creation page
steps.expectedResult: Booking form is displayed with all necessary fields

steps.action: Select an available resource that has no bookings for the desired time slot (e.g., Meeting Room B)
steps.expectedResult: Resource is selected and displayed in the form

steps.action: Select a date and time slot for which the resource is available (e.g., 1:00 PM to 2:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: No conflict alerts or double-booking warnings are shown, form remains in valid state

steps.action: Complete all other required booking information (purpose, attendees, notes, etc.)
steps.expectedResult: All fields are filled correctly

steps.action: Submit the booking by clicking the Save or Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Booking is saved successfully, success confirmation message is displayed, and the booking appears in the system

postconditions: New booking is created and stored in the resource allocation database
Resource is marked as booked for the selected time slot
Confirmation message is displayed to the scheduler
Booking is visible in the schedule view

testCases.title: Ensure double-booking detection latency is under 1 second
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Resource allocation database contains multiple existing bookings
Performance measurement tools are available (browser developer tools, network tab, or stopwatch)
At least one resource has an existing booking to trigger double-booking detection

steps.action: Navigate to the booking creation page
steps.expectedResult: Booking form is displayed

steps.action: Prepare timing measurement tool (start browser network monitoring or ready stopwatch)
steps.expectedResult: Timing tool is ready to measure response time

steps.action: Start timer and immediately select a resource that is already booked for a specific time slot
steps.expectedResult: Resource selection is registered

steps.action: Select the time slot that causes a double-booking conflict
steps.expectedResult: Double-booking alert appears on the screen

steps.action: Stop timer when the alert is fully visible and measure the elapsed time
steps.expectedResult: Elapsed time from resource and time selection to alert display is less than 1 second (under 1000 milliseconds)

steps.action: Verify the alert contains accurate resource and booking conflict details
steps.expectedResult: Alert displays correct resource name, conflicting booking ID, and time information

postconditions: Performance requirement of under 1 second latency is validated
Double-booking detection system meets performance standards
No booking is created
Alert remains visible for scheduler review

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to handle concurrent scheduling inputs without missing conflicts

testCases.title: Validate conflict detection under concurrent booking submissions
preconditions: Scheduling system is operational and accessible
Database has transaction support enabled
At least 2 scheduler accounts are authenticated and active
Test environment can support 100 concurrent connections
Database is populated with existing bookings for conflict testing
API endpoint POST /api/bookings is available and responding

steps.action: Prepare 100 booking submission requests with overlapping time slots (e.g., 50 bookings for Room A from 10:00-11:00, 50 bookings for Room A from 10:30-11:30)
steps.expectedResult: Test data is prepared with intentional time overlaps across multiple resources

steps.action: Execute automated script or load testing tool to simulate 100 concurrent booking submissions to POST /api/bookings endpoint
steps.expectedResult: All 100 requests are sent simultaneously within a 1-second window

steps.action: Monitor system response for each submission and capture all conflict detection alerts
steps.expectedResult: System processes all 100 submissions and returns responses for each request

steps.action: Verify that all overlapping bookings are identified as conflicts with appropriate error messages
steps.expectedResult: System detects 100% of conflicts accurately - all overlapping time slots are flagged with conflict alerts

steps.action: Query the database to retrieve all bookings created during the concurrent submission test
steps.expectedResult: Database query returns only the bookings that were successfully saved

steps.action: Verify that no conflicting bookings exist in the database by checking for time overlaps on the same resources
steps.expectedResult: Database contains only conflict-free bookings - no two bookings overlap for the same resource

steps.action: Review system logs for any race condition errors, deadlocks, or transaction failures
steps.expectedResult: No race conditions, deadlocks, or transaction integrity issues are logged

postconditions: Database contains only valid, non-conflicting bookings
All conflicting booking attempts are rejected and logged
System remains stable and responsive
Transaction logs show proper atomic operations
No orphaned or incomplete booking records exist

testCases.title: Ensure no data loss or errors during concurrent submissions
preconditions: Scheduling system is operational and accessible
Database has sufficient capacity for concurrent transactions
Multiple scheduler accounts (minimum 10) are authenticated
Test environment supports concurrent connections
Baseline booking count is recorded in database
API endpoint POST /api/bookings is available

steps.action: Record the current count of bookings in the database as baseline
steps.expectedResult: Baseline booking count is documented (e.g., 150 existing bookings)

steps.action: Prepare 100 valid booking submissions with non-overlapping time slots across different resources
steps.expectedResult: Test data contains 100 unique, valid booking requests with no conflicts

steps.action: Execute concurrent submission of all 100 valid bookings using multiple scheduler accounts simultaneously
steps.expectedResult: All 100 booking requests are submitted concurrently to the system

steps.action: Monitor API responses for each submission and capture HTTP status codes and response messages
steps.expectedResult: All submissions receive responses (either success 201 or appropriate error codes)

steps.action: Verify that all valid bookings receive success responses (HTTP 201 Created) without errors
steps.expectedResult: 100 success responses are received with no 500-series errors or timeout failures

steps.action: Query the database and count total bookings after concurrent submission
steps.expectedResult: Database count shows baseline + 100 bookings (e.g., 250 total bookings)

steps.action: Verify data integrity by checking that all submitted booking details match database records
steps.expectedResult: All 100 bookings are saved with complete and accurate data - no data loss or corruption

steps.action: Review application logs and database logs for any errors, warnings, or transaction rollbacks
steps.expectedResult: No errors, data loss warnings, or unexpected transaction rollbacks are logged

steps.action: Check for duplicate bookings or orphaned records in the database
steps.expectedResult: No duplicate bookings exist and no orphaned or incomplete records are found

postconditions: All 100 valid bookings are successfully saved in database
No data loss or corruption occurred
Database integrity is maintained
System logs show successful concurrent processing
No duplicate or orphaned records exist
System performance remains within acceptable parameters

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to validate all mandatory fields before scheduling to avoid incomplete bookings

testCases.title: Verify validation blocks booking submission with missing mandatory fields
preconditions: Scheduler is logged into the system with valid credentials
Booking form is accessible and loaded completely
All mandatory fields are identified (e.g., Date, Time, Resource, Attendees)
Frontend and backend validation are both enabled
Network connection is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the booking creation form
steps.expectedResult: Booking form is displayed with all mandatory fields clearly marked (e.g., with asterisks)

steps.action: Leave the 'Date' mandatory field empty and click or tab to the next field
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation error message appears below the 'Date' field (e.g., 'Date is required')

steps.action: Leave the 'Time' mandatory field empty and click or tab to the next field
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation error message appears below the 'Time' field (e.g., 'Time is required')

steps.action: Leave the 'Resource' mandatory field empty and click or tab to the next field
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation error message appears below the 'Resource' field (e.g., 'Resource is required')

steps.action: Leave the 'Attendees' mandatory field empty and click or tab to the next field
steps.expectedResult: Inline validation error message appears below the 'Attendees' field (e.g., 'At least one attendee is required')

steps.action: Verify that all inline error messages are displayed simultaneously for all empty mandatory fields
steps.expectedResult: All mandatory fields with missing data show inline validation error messages

steps.action: Attempt to click the 'Submit' or 'Create Booking' button with mandatory fields still empty
steps.expectedResult: Submission is blocked and the button either remains disabled or shows a validation summary error message

steps.action: Verify that a summary error message is displayed at the top of the form indicating incomplete submission
steps.expectedResult: Error message appears (e.g., 'Please complete all mandatory fields before submitting')

steps.action: Verify that no API call to POST /api/bookings is made by checking network traffic
steps.expectedResult: No POST request is sent to the backend - frontend validation prevents submission

postconditions: No booking is created in the database
Form remains in edit mode with error messages displayed
User remains on the booking form page
All validation error messages are visible to the scheduler

testCases.title: Ensure booking submission succeeds when all mandatory fields are filled
preconditions: Scheduler is logged into the system with valid credentials
Booking form is accessible and loaded completely
All mandatory fields are identified
Valid test data is prepared for all mandatory fields
Backend API POST /api/bookings is operational

steps.action: Navigate to the booking creation form
steps.expectedResult: Booking form is displayed with all fields ready for input

steps.action: Fill in the 'Date' mandatory field with a valid future date (e.g., tomorrow's date)
steps.expectedResult: Date is accepted and no validation error is shown for this field

steps.action: Fill in the 'Time' mandatory field with a valid time slot (e.g., 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM)
steps.expectedResult: Time is accepted and no validation error is shown for this field

steps.action: Select a valid resource from the 'Resource' mandatory field dropdown (e.g., Conference Room A)
steps.expectedResult: Resource is selected and no validation error is shown for this field

steps.action: Add at least one attendee in the 'Attendees' mandatory field (e.g., john.doe@example.com)
steps.expectedResult: Attendee is added and no validation error is shown for this field

steps.action: Fill in any other mandatory fields as required by the form
steps.expectedResult: All mandatory fields are completed with valid data

steps.action: Verify that no validation error messages are displayed on the form
steps.expectedResult: No inline validation errors are shown - all fields display as valid

steps.action: Verify that the 'Submit' or 'Create Booking' button is enabled and clickable
steps.expectedResult: Submit button is enabled and ready for interaction

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' or 'Create Booking' button
steps.expectedResult: Form is submitted and a POST request is sent to /api/bookings endpoint

steps.action: Wait for the system response and verify success confirmation message is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Success message appears (e.g., 'Booking created successfully') with HTTP 201 status

steps.action: Verify that the booking appears in the scheduler's booking list or calendar view
steps.expectedResult: New booking is visible with all entered details displayed correctly

steps.action: Query the database to confirm the booking record exists with all mandatory field data
steps.expectedResult: Database contains the new booking record with complete and accurate data

postconditions: Booking is successfully created and saved in database
Scheduler receives confirmation of successful booking
Booking appears in the system calendar/schedule
All mandatory field data is persisted correctly
Form is either cleared or redirected to booking list view

testCases.title: Test validation feedback latency under 500 milliseconds
preconditions: Scheduler is logged into the system with valid credentials
Booking form is accessible and loaded completely
Browser developer tools or performance monitoring tool is available
Network latency is within normal parameters (< 100ms)
System is under normal load conditions

steps.action: Open browser developer tools and navigate to the Performance or Network tab
steps.expectedResult: Developer tools are open and ready to capture timing metrics

steps.action: Navigate to the booking creation form
steps.expectedResult: Booking form is fully loaded and ready for input

steps.action: Start performance recording or prepare to measure time from input to validation feedback
steps.expectedResult: Performance monitoring is active and capturing events

steps.action: Enter invalid data in the 'Date' field (e.g., past date or invalid format) and tab out of the field
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message appears for the Date field

steps.action: Measure the time elapsed between losing focus on the field and the validation message appearing
steps.expectedResult: Validation feedback appears within 500 milliseconds (ideally < 300ms)

steps.action: Clear the 'Date' field, leave it empty, and tab out of the field
steps.expectedResult: Required field validation error message appears for the Date field

steps.action: Measure the time elapsed between losing focus and the validation message appearing
steps.expectedResult: Validation feedback appears within 500 milliseconds

steps.action: Enter invalid data in the 'Time' field (e.g., invalid time format) and tab out
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message appears within 500 milliseconds

steps.action: Enter invalid data in the 'Attendees' field (e.g., invalid email format) and tab out
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message appears within 500 milliseconds

steps.action: Fill all mandatory fields with valid data and click the Submit button
steps.expectedResult: Form validation completes and submission proceeds or backend validation responds within 500 milliseconds

steps.action: Review performance metrics and validation timing logs
steps.expectedResult: All validation feedback events occurred within the 500ms threshold

steps.action: Document the maximum validation latency observed across all field validations
steps.expectedResult: Maximum latency is documented and is less than or equal to 500 milliseconds

postconditions: All validation feedback latencies are within 500ms threshold
Performance metrics are documented
No validation delays or UI freezing occurred
System responsiveness meets performance requirements

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the system to handle error scenarios gracefully during conflict detection

testCases.title: Verify graceful handling of backend errors during conflict detection
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduler
Scheduling interface is accessible
Backend service can be configured to simulate errors
Test environment has error simulation capability enabled
At least one scheduling request is ready to be processed

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduling interface and prepare to create or modify a schedule
steps.expectedResult: Scheduling interface loads successfully and displays available options

steps.action: Configure backend to simulate an error during conflict detection (e.g., database timeout, service unavailable, network error)
steps.expectedResult: Backend error simulation is configured and ready to trigger on next conflict detection request

steps.action: Initiate conflict detection by attempting to schedule an appointment or resource
steps.expectedResult: System attempts to perform conflict detection and encounters the simulated backend error

steps.action: Observe the error message displayed to the user
steps.expectedResult: User sees a clear, non-technical error message such as 'We encountered an issue checking for scheduling conflicts. Please try again or contact support if the problem persists.' No technical stack traces or error codes are visible

steps.action: Verify that retry and cancel options are available in the error message dialog
steps.expectedResult: Error dialog displays 'Retry' and 'Cancel' buttons clearly visible to the user

steps.action: Click the 'Retry' button to attempt conflict detection again
steps.expectedResult: System reprocesses the conflict detection request. If error persists, same error message appears. If successful, conflict detection completes normally

steps.action: Trigger the error scenario again and click 'Cancel' button
steps.expectedResult: Operation is cancelled gracefully, user returns to previous screen or scheduling interface without data loss, and no system crash occurs

steps.action: Verify system remains stable and responsive after error handling
steps.expectedResult: System continues to function normally, other features remain accessible, and user can perform other scheduling operations

postconditions: System remains stable and operational
User session is maintained without logout
No data corruption has occurred
Error has been logged in system error logs
User can continue with other scheduling tasks

testCases.title: Ensure errors are logged with sufficient detail
preconditions: User is logged in as Scheduler
System error logging is enabled and accessible
Access to system logs or logging dashboard is available
Backend can be configured to trigger specific error scenarios
Timestamp synchronization is working correctly

steps.action: Access the system error logs or logging dashboard before triggering the error
steps.expectedResult: Error logs are accessible and current log entries are visible with timestamps

steps.action: Note the current timestamp and prepare to trigger an error scenario
steps.expectedResult: Current timestamp is recorded for log verification purposes

steps.action: Configure backend to simulate a specific error during conflict detection (e.g., database connection failure)
steps.expectedResult: Error simulation is configured with identifiable characteristics

steps.action: Trigger the error scenario by initiating conflict detection from the scheduling interface
steps.expectedResult: Conflict detection fails with the simulated error and user sees error message

steps.action: Access the system error logs immediately after the error occurs
steps.expectedResult: New error log entry is created and visible in the logging system

steps.action: Verify the error log contains accurate timestamp matching the time of error occurrence
steps.expectedResult: Log entry shows timestamp within seconds of when the error was triggered

steps.action: Verify the error log contains user context information (user ID, username, or session ID)
steps.expectedResult: Log entry includes user identification information showing which Scheduler triggered the error

steps.action: Verify the error log contains operation context (conflict detection, scheduling details, affected resources)
steps.expectedResult: Log entry includes details about what operation was being performed and which resources or schedules were involved

steps.action: Verify the error log contains technical error details (error type, error code, stack trace if applicable)
steps.expectedResult: Log entry includes sufficient technical information for developers to diagnose the issue, including error type and relevant stack trace

steps.action: Verify the error log contains severity level classification
steps.expectedResult: Log entry is marked with appropriate severity level (e.g., ERROR, CRITICAL) for proper alerting and prioritization

steps.action: Trigger multiple different error scenarios and verify each is logged distinctly
steps.expectedResult: Each error scenario creates a separate, identifiable log entry with scenario-specific details

postconditions: All triggered errors are logged in the system
Error logs contain complete diagnostic information
Logs are accessible for support team review
No sensitive user information is exposed in logs
Log storage is functioning correctly
